With Maduro abduction, Trump flexes muscles and sends world a message
subhead: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro was abducted by US special forces. He is to stand trial before a federal court in New York on charges of 'narcoterrorism conspiracy.' Donald Trump has announced that the US plans to 'run' Venezuela up until a 'proper transition' and to exploit its oil reserves.

title: UK and France strike IS site in Syria
subhead: The British defense ministry said warplanes had targeted an underground facility where members of the Islamic State group are suspected to have stored weapons.

title: The kingdom of the 'shamassa,' Sudan's children of war
subhead: 'War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation' (4/6) 'Shamassa' means 'child of the sun,' but these street children wear the name poorly. Turned into easy prey by the conflict, the orphans live at the mercy of armed groups, telling the story of war through a child's eyes.

title: French managers of Swiss bar face criminal probe after fire
subhead: The two owners of Le Constellation bar at the Swiss resort of Crans-Montana said that they followed all safety norms.

title: When fertility treatments fail, 'society has no words, only silence'
subhead: Ending the process of medically assisted reproduction remains a taboo subject. Couples in this situation often feel alone, facing a grief that cannot be expressed.

In Khartoum, the faces of a martyred capital: 'War cannot kill ideas, nor love'
subhead: War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation (3/6). Le Monde's reporters traveled through the Sudanese capital, which for two years was the epicenter of the conflict. They met with residents, who recounted how they survived despite fear and violence.

title: How four years of war in Ukraine redefined the European Union
subhead: With Russia's aggression against Ukraine, the world that saw the construction of EU has all but disappeared. The 27 member states belatedly recognized that peace was 'no longer a given in Europe,' and awoke to their military weakness and energy dependence.

title: Early Christian fresco depicting Jesus as the Good Shepherd discovered in Turkey
subhead: One month after Pope Leo XIV's visit, Turkish authorities announced the discovery in Iznik, Anatolia, of a depiction of Christ in a well-preserved burial chamber.
